own measurements instead of relying on a gauge swatch you ll be measuring on your body as you work the pattern this allows you to use your own choice of yarn and coordinating hook for a size small i used just shy of 3 skeins of big twist living 597 yards i used approximately 520 yards of i love this cotton yarn 3 skeins or 459 yards of print and about 60 yards of white with cotton yarn i have found i prefer dropping down one hook size than the yarn recommends so my stitches are a little tighter/denser for example the i love this cotton yarn recommends a size 5 5mm hook i used a 5mm hook for the big twist living yarn shown in the tutorial photos i stuck with the recommended 4 5mm hook you will not chain at the end of each row of the waistband this will result in a cleaner edge on the ribbing if you find it diyicult to locate your last stitch to crochet into use a stitch marker to identify it the main ripple pattern of this skirt is in multiples of 8 stitches pattern is created in the round and is designed to be the same width from top to bottom and form fitting at the end of the pattern document i did include row charts for the body of the skirt ribbed waistband chain 9 note if you would like a wider waistband chain additional stitches for a narrower waistband chain fewer stitches whatever the stitch count you d like for the width chain 1 additional stitch chaining 9 will
